title: What are the most realistic cowboy movies? - Quora

response.answer_text: None, most westerns by Hollywood have errors in weapons, leather goods, dresses on women, man’s clothing wrong. Use of buttons, snaps, zippers, how the pistol was carried all wrong. Seeing everyone with leg iron and/or lever action rifle, wrong. Most places you would be breaking the law with open carry. The vest pocket carried small pistol or inside pocket of a vest. The rag around the neck usually was left over from making his wife’s dress. If you like to smoke, then your cigarettes was hand rolled or nickel cigar. To light your smoke you would use a candle or piece of firewood. Matches were expense and hard to fine. The drop loop in the gun belt is Hollywood completely. The cost of new Colt would be good month wages and same for good lever rifle. A used shotgun was less than $1.00 to $0.50. More people carried a shotgun for hunting and protect the home front.

The realism showed in these movies is surreal. It can happen to everybody and anybody.
